description: Hypatia of Alexandria, was a Greek mathematician, astronomer, inventor, and philosopher in Egypt, then part of the Eastern Roman Empire. She was the head of the Neoplatonic school at Alexandria, where she taught philosophy and astronomy until her murder.
Hildegard of Bingen OSB was a German Benedictine abbess, writer, composer, philosopher and Christian mystic. She is considered to be the founder of scientific natural history in Germany.

Cavendish published under her own name at a time when most women writers published anonymously. She wrote extensively about natural philosophy, modern science and also wrote one of the first science fiction novels.
